Prescaler divider not respecting Fadc Min Max Constraint
Prescaler divider not respecting Fadc Min Max Constraint

RefParameter.Description: frequency of the clock to the ADC. The clock is common for all the ADCs.

RefParameter.Description: Selected the channels bank used to select channel sources in Regular and Injected conversion.

RefParameter.Name: Resolution
RefParameter.Description: Resolution of the ADC conversion

RefParameter.Name: DataAlign
RefParameter.Description: Select the alignment of the data stored after conversion.

RefParameter.Name: ScanConvMode
RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable DMA Continuous Requests

Condition.Diagnostic: Continuous and Discontinuous modes could not be used at the same time

RefParameter.Name: ContinuousConvMode
RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the Continuous Conversion Mode

Condition.Diagnostic: Continuous and Discontinuous modes could not be used at the same time
Discontinuous mode is used only if Scan Mode is enabled

RefParameter.Name: DiscontinuousConvMode
RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the Discontinuous Conversion Mode

RefParameter.Name: DMAContinuousRequests

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: A DMA Request in Circular Mode must be configured in DMA Settings Tab for this ADC instance

RefParameter.Description:
This parameter is used only when a DMA Request is configured. Else it is not relevant.
When the DMA Request for this ADC instance this parameter specifies whether the DMA requests are performed in one shot mode (DMA transfer stops when number of conversions is reached) or are performed in continuous mode (DMA transfer unlimited, whatever number of conversions).
Note: In continuous mode, DMA must be configured in circular mode. Otherwise an overrun will be triggered when DMA buffer maximum pointer is reached.

RefParameter.Name: EOCSelection
RefParameter.Description: Regular channel end of conversion selection

RefParameter.Name: LowPowerAutoWait

PossibleValue.Comment: Wait until the result of previous conversion is read

RefParameter.Description: Specifies the usage of dynamic low power Auto Delay: New conversion start only when the previous conversion (for regular group) or previous sequence (for injected group) has been treated by user software.

RefParameter.Name: LowPowerAutoPowerOff

PossibleValue.Comment: power off when ADC is not converting
power off when a delay is inserted between conversions
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: A delay should be selected in 'Low Power Auto Wait' parameter

PossibleValue.Comment: power off when ADC is not converting and when a delay is inserted between conversions
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: A delay should be selected in 'Low Power Auto Wait' parameter

RefParameter.Description: The ADC automatically powers-off after a conversion and automatically wakes-up when a new conversion is triggered

RefParameter.Name: NbrOfConversion

Condition.Diagnostic: for cat3, cat4 and cat5 the number of regular conversion is 28

RefParameter.Description: Number of regular channels to be converted

RefParameter.Name: NbrOfConversion
RefParameter.Description: Number of regular channels to be converted

Condition.Diagnostic: EXTI Line11 is used for External-Trigger-for-Regular-conversion mode.

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigConv
RefParameter.Description: Select the external event used to trigger the start of conversion of a regular group

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigConvEdge
RefParameter.Description: Select the external trigger polarity and enable the trigger of a regular group.

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigConvEdge

PossibleValue.Comment: Trigger detection on the rising edge
Trigger detection on the falling edge
Trigger detection on the rising and falling edges

RefParameter.Description: Select the external trigger polarity and enable the trigger of a regular group.

RefParameter.Name: Rank

Condition.Diagnostic: for cat3, cat4 and cat5 the number of regular conversion is 28

RefParameter.Description: The rank in the regular group sequencer

RefParameter.Name: Rank
RefParameter.Description: The rank in the regular group sequencer

RefParameter.Name: SamplingTime
RefParameter.Description: Regular Channel x sampling time selection

RefParameter.Name: InjNumberOfConversion
RefParameter.Description: Number of injected channels to be converted

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigInjecConv
RefParameter.Description: EXTI Line15 is used for External-Trigger-for-Injected-conversion mode

PossibleValue.Comment: External Trigger on injected channels are disabled (Auto-injection mode selected)

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigInjecConv
RefParameter.Description: Select the external event used to trigger the start of conversion of an injected group

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigInjecConvEdge
RefParameter.Description: You cannot configure a trigger because the Auto Injected mode is selected.

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigInjecConvEdge

PossibleValue.Comment: Trigger detection on the rising edge
Trigger detection on the falling edge
Trigger detection on the rising and falling edges

RefParameter.Description: Select the external trigger polarity and enable the trigger of a regular group: When an external trigger is selected for ADC regular or injected conversion, only the rising edge of the signal can start the conversion.

Condition.Diagnostic: Discontinuous mode could not be used on regular and injected group at the same time

RefParameter.Description: Injected Conversion Mode selection

RefParameter.Name: InjectedRank
RefParameter.Description: The rank in the regular group sequencer

RefParameter.Name: InjectedSamplingTime
RefParameter.Description: Regular Channel x sampling time selection

RefParameter.Name: InjectedOffset
RefParameter.Description: Data offset for Injected channel

RefParameter.Name: EnableAnalogWatchDog
RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable Analog WatchDog Mode

RefParameter.Name: WatchdogMode
RefParameter.Description: Configures the ADC analog watchdog mode.

RefParameter.Name: WatchdogMode
RefParameter.Description: Configures the ADC analog watchdog mode.

RefParameter.Name: WatchdogChannel
RefParameter.Description: ADC channel for the analog watchdog

RefParameter.Name: HighThreshold
RefParameter.Description: Configures the ADC analog watchdog High threshold value.

RefParameter.Name: LowThreshold
RefParameter.Description: Configures the ADC analog watchdog Low threshold value.

RefParameter.Name: ITMode
RefParameter.Description: Specifies whether the analog watchdog is configured in interrupt mode or in polling mode.
